website_summaries.verdict: The best budget sound card for laptop users wanting a basic audio or headphone connection.
pros: Small audio card is easy to roll up and tie for fitting into laptop bags and cases
Sound card works with very little set up or driver installation
cons: Does not perform well with audio-intensive media like games, TV shows, and movies

customer_reviews.title: Works great with ModMic 5!!  Quality build for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use this for my ModMic 5. My on-board Mic-Input had horrible background noise which is surprising because it's Asus's X299 flagship, the Rampage XI Extreme **sigh**. Anyway, this was a perfect solution being that I use an external DAC/amp for the my headphones. I used some double sided adhesive and set the unit right next to my DAC using a USB extension. I love it! Had an integrated mute and volume button. Sounds amazing! As other users have stated the input is only Mono which is fine for a mic but not ok for other audio inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Danny W.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with gaming headsets.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to try and get rid of some signal noise on my microphone inputs for my motherboard. I have a pair of Kingston HyperX Stingers and the output works fine. However, the microphone is so low It is nearly impossible to hear. I also have the microphone input volume turned up all the way. The same headset works fine on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Tucker Henline

customer_reviews.title: Find a different unit if you need a 3.5mm TRRS
customer_reviews.text: While this device works, the flat USB cable is almost a deal breaker because it's rigid, but doesn't give a very sturdy or stable feel. I keep being concerned I'm one flex away from popping it open. The audio quality is also weird, a little staticky. The same headphones sounded better in a cheap Sabrent 3.5mm plug with digital-only volume control too. There's also an LED that is constantly blinking whenever sound is playing and there's no way to disable it. I put a piece of tape over it on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Works with PS4/Blue Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Works with PS4. I have a Blue Yeti that I use for streaming, but I also wanted to use the same mic for the PS4 when playing with friends. The Yeti has a headphones monitor 3.5mm output. Prior to buying this I was using a splitter plugged into the controller. This device allowed me to eliminate cable clutter from the controller, which is really nice. It's a niche application, but if you are streaming with a capture card/PC setup then this product may help route audio without creating a mess of cables plugged into the PS4 controller.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Middle headset jack does not work. Nort
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work as advertised. I plugged a headset into the middle jack and the USB end into a USB 3.0 port. The microphone does not function, even though I hear audio through the headphones. Also, I ordered a BENGOO product and a "Kotion Each" device is what showed up at my doorstep. Product feels extremely cheap and the volume adjustment wheel rattles around like a happy meal toy
customer_reviews.author: Rob Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Works with a Turtle Beach Recon 50X
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to a Turtle Beach Recon 50X and a Dell T3500 that has an old AMD 6870. This usb card worked as a plug and play device pretty easily. I didn't notice a DVD for any driver but I just used it as plug and play. It works well. The only grip is that the device is not very loud. It is not quiet but I can't get it to be loud either; therefore, the little volume mixer on the side is always at max volume. It works and does the job, not a deal breaker, but I wish I could have produced more volume out of this little guy - my daughter seems to not notice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Switch compatible!
customer_reviews.text: Works with my nintendo switch! I have it plugged in to one of the usb 2.0 ports on the front of the dock. Now when I long press the home key it says usb audio instead of headphones. I have it plugged into my mackie cr4 bookshelf monitors. I haven't tried the microphone or headset ports but I imagine they would work since people have been able to use usb headsets (wired or wireless). This eliminates the inconvenience of plugging and unplugging into the headphone port when you transition from portable to docked.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: There was a lot to like about this out of the box. It helped me get audio input and output needed to work through some live streaming options I was working on. However, after about a month of normal twice per week use, it seems to have shorted out in the microphone side of the house, so it no longer takes input. Only output. Disappointing, as my return window closed just days ago. Hopefully this helps others be sure to try this product out and put it through its paces as soon as you receive.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew DeWolf

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: My new HP pc doesn't take the older 3 pin patch cord on my 5-1 sound system, so I thought this might be a work-around. It certainly attaches easily enough, but what now comes out of my system is a shadow of what it is capable to producing, especially with ref to the bass - there's hardly any. I'm going to keep looking for something else before buying a new system that patches via USB.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: It works with Google Hangout on my PC Win7 machine
customer_reviews.text: Plugged my mobile ear buds into the unit, and into the PC and launched Google Hangouts. Worked right away. I'm bit hard of hearing and this solution solved that problem. When I go out on a call with the laptop this adapter is brought along and so far it has worked every time. Sound quality is going to depend on the earphones/ear buds that you use.
customer_reviews.author: LT Xanax

customer_reviews.title: It records fine, my only issue is the headphone jacks
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this sound card for recording instruments through a mixer to my HP x360 Spectre laptop. It records fine, my only issue is the headphone jacks. The sound, no matter how loud the volume is, is very faint through the sound card's headphone jacks. If you playback what you recorded through the laptop speakers, the sound is perfect. No pops hisses or static.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Congeniality

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good item. I bought it so I could use an ear pod style headphone with mic with my PC (the same headphone you would use for an iPhone. I could not find a PC sound card with the single 1/8 plug for both sound and mic. I did try these inexpensive splitters that combine stereo and mic into one, but the mic was way too soft. This device is working fine with no microphone degradation. I knocked off one star because after one day, it stopped working and I needed to reboot, but then it worked again. It’s been working non-stop for two weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd761

customer_reviews.title: Good device for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this to be able to use my PS Vita earbug/mic combo on the PC for gaming by plugging into the center port. However the USB cable must have developed a bit of a short in it after about 6 months of using it, as I can only get stereo sound through the earbuds if the cable is bent a certain way.
customer_reviews.author: Art Vandelay

customer_reviews.title: I've got TWO!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great, I have one for my travel pack and one on my desk. I work from home and teleconference a lot, having a volume dial, microphone+headphone mute buttons right at my fingertips is great. Yeah, there are mute buttons in WebEx/Hangouts, but this gives me a physical light and switch telling me it's muted which has helped prevent some slip-ups before! It kinda feels like cheap Chinese crap but it works well and they're cheap enough to where I don't worry about it. For the application, it's more than solid.
customer_reviews.author: Gentleman Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money and
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, and received no response from seller hoping to get fixed. Trash, and baffled by it being "Amazon's Choice". Don't waste your money and time
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Arwood

customer_reviews.title: Bengoo makes good
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for two years and then developed scratches in the sound output. I finally traced it to this device, eliminating the headphones and cables. It probably was due to a poor fit between the cable and the output of this device. Although the purchase was two years old, Bengoo sent me a replacement free of charge. For that reason I'm upgrading the rating to he highest possible.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Waldman

customer_reviews.title: Great For Recording and Zoom
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for some time, but just started using it again since COVID has increased my use of Zoom calls for business. What I love about it most is how it lets me connect my external audio recorder, as well as my headset. I can participate in the conference and record it at the same time. This allows me to review key parts of the meeting later. Works perfectly and seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After A few Months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use it with a microphone and be able to connect my headphones to listen to myself while I recorded. Unfortunately, this has stopped working after about six months of use. It's always in the same place, so the problem was not moving so I am not sure why they would completely stop working, but none the less, they did.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Precisely what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Product information was lacking -1 star. Overall, very good quality of manufacture and materials. Icons difficult to see for an old man like me, but that's why I have a pair of 3X cheaters and a headlamp from Walmart. Just what I needed for Raspberry Pi audio. Uses one USB port. No installation process ...just plug it in and listen. I still haven't learned what the big button is for?
customer_reviews.author: Robert G Layton

customer_reviews.title: Speakers stay on when you attach Headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you want to add speakers to this external card and then plug in headphones into the other jack, this may not be the card for you. As the title says, the speakers stay on when you attach headphones. It does not matter which plug you use. This is on a clean install of Windows 10. Otherwise, the external card works fine. Lastly, reboot your system after you plug it in. At first, windows recognizes it and installs the drivers, however it may not function correctly. The sound only came out of one set of speakers until I rebooted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to increase the volume on my PS4, which the item's description clearly states that it supports, and the sound is exactly the same as what I am getting with my headset being plugged into my controller. My headset already has 7.1 virtual surround sound, so I don't know if it adds that ability to a stereo headset, but if you want something to make the sound louder than you are normally getting then purchase a different product. I tried it out and returned it the same day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Finish Detailing

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day for work to listen to music and youtube videos while I work from home, this is a great purchase for me so I can easily connect it to my USB hub and don't have to extend my headphone cord several feet to make it to my computer. If you need/want something like this, I think this is a great buy to give you a bit of manual control over your audio.
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy fix for malfunctioning sound card
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. Brand new computer at work, but my audio peripherals just did not work well. IT updated the drivers and tried a bunch of workarounds which would not stick. Frustrating to have a sound card issue on a brand new computer, but this was a great $10 fix. Plugged this in, and my speaker and microphone work great.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Smith

customer_reviews.title: This lets me use my work desktop for audio/video meetings
customer_reviews.text: I have a work desktop that does not accept 3.5mm headsets to use for computer audio/video meetings. Company supplied a wireless solution which interferes with a wireless insulin pump & constant glucose monitor. This worked as a wired alternative and probably cost 1/10th as much, it doesn’t have the wireless freedom and I wish it had a longer USB cable.
customer_reviews.author: John Secondino

customer_reviews.title: Great For Using Console Headsets on PC
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I accidentally pulled on my headset cable a couple of times with either my arm or my armrest on my chair and ultimately somewhat ruined the device. It still works but I gotta find the "sweet spot", which doesn't take long and isn't game ruining. So just be carefully because this device is not made of steel. Great product! I bought this to use my XboxOne headset on my PC. As many know a PC requires an Audio and a Mic input (green and pink inputs) but console wired headsets are usually a single input for both so this device is perfect for those who don't want to buy another headset for PC.
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: Great, but with some difficulties.
customer_reviews.text: So I thought I was getting a ps3 adapter which apparently it is not, but I was able to get it to work. Biggest complaint is that the sound and voice volume control is one knob, so I can't adjust them separately. This might not be an issue on other systems. I thought the sound quality was excellent and the virtual surround sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Slice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: arrived without instructions. Apparent volume dial obvious, but buttons for each side were a mystery. Turns out they are off and on for each device but takes experimenting. In Preferences, you must set input and output to USB device. After some fidgeting, it works as it should. stopped working after a week but supplier sent a new one immediatley new one arrived with instructions and works as it should. a good alternative to the sound input socket'I am impressed with the company, very good service
customer_reviews.author: Michael Burke

customer_reviews.title: Update 6-15-2019 "Meh."
customer_reviews.text: "Meh. I seem to have better performance from cheaper adapters." Update: This thing did save me some time and money today. My computer sound card died and all I had was this guy. Just plugged it into an open USB slot and connected the speakers to the green headphone slot, and the sound I got was really good. I still think a cheaper one I got was way better for Mics, but the sound coming out of this guy is sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Casey A. Lasalle Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for when your MOBO's audio jack dies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to solve the problem of static over my motherboards audio jacks. It's worked great and removed any problems I had with selecting mic inputs and audio out. Its also nice becuase it enables the use of three pole headsets commonly used by older headsets. It also work with the V-mod Boom Mic Pro which has allowed me to use my M-100s with my computer while not having to use the adapter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no issues. Truly plug and play. No drivers required. I even have this plugged into a USB switcher and when I switch computers it automatically works on the new computer and allows me to have 1 set of headphones for all my devices at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Flagler

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time for anyone looking for sound enhancements.
customer_reviews.text: Backstory: I got this since I wanted sound improvements on my ps4(sound enhancement). I was ill informed via youtube videos. This would be ideal for someone with messed up sound card or mic port on pcs/laptops. The videos lead me to believe this sound card would improve the sound on my cheap headset for my ps4 slim. This thing makes 0 difference. Sound was the same. Highly disappointed, even tried my friend's headset with it. 0 Difference. Plus the rubber over the usb makes it hard to insert into the ps4 slim's usb port. 1/10
customer_reviews.author: T Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Feels very cheap.. Site says one product I received another and it worked fine but feels very very cheap something you'd find at dollar tree but if your sound card isn't working buy this, for the price it's hard to beat. Besides that it doesn't offer anyone anything new! Just buy if your ok with a generic sound card adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Crabby

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: This does pretty good. Only downfall I have found is that when I plug a headset into the middle one (which has a 4 studded 3.5mm prong) and then a 3 studded line in prong at the same time the three stud affects the four stud and causes issues with the mic and speakers of the headset. Didn't test further but I am sure it affected the quality of the line in as well. Not sure if other sound cards wouldn't have the same affect though
customer_reviews.author: Shinrai

customer_reviews.title: Good price and great service
customer_reviews.text: The company has a good service policy. When I ordered the item, I didn't see right away that it would arrive only mid May. once I noticed it, I cancelled the order with the reason that it would arrive too late. My computer's headset plug just broke and I needed that USB adapter. Staying at home like everyone else, no fun. To my surprise the item was shipped immediately and arrived 2 days later! That was cool. I am very happy with the adapter because I can have a second person plug in, the volume is easily regulated for talking and listening and sounds better than the one I had so far on my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Ninusha

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Xbox 360
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to run on Xbox 360 Rock Band and the Xbox did not recognize a microphone being inserted. I understand this is not the intended function but there was some ambiguity in reviews so to clarify I am using an Xbox 360 Slim and used a known good microphone.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for high end gaming headsets
customer_reviews.text: I have a high end gaming headset, a Sennheiser. I was hoping this would work for my headset. Unfortunately, this adapter does not provide enough power for the microphone to work on my headset. I can hear just fine, but no one can hear me. Ive plugged it directly into the computer and everyone hears me just fine, so clearly the issue is with the adapter. However, If I use just a basic headset, it works just fine. A bit of a bummer I can't use my nice headset, I have to use a cheapo junky one.
customer_reviews.author: Siren

customer_reviews.title: Delivered as advertised. Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I have not tested all its functions Don't have much time right now, so here is the likes and dislikes so far: D: no application to EASILY manage it and my PC's native audio. Mostly to disable/enable either when it is unplugged or plugged in D: (tbc :-p) L: volume control in device itself. L: sound quality is good enough for me. At least as good as my Dell laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Reality Bluff

customer_reviews.title: Great sound card replacement
customer_reviews.text: My sound card died and this was great . Plug it in and it works, nothing else to do. And the sound volume and quality are excellent. I cannot properly comment on gaming because I do not use this computer for that purpose but this system requires a rating for that, so I put 5 stars because it is probably good.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play on Ubuntu Linux 19.10
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and volume. My old sound card had very low volume and I could not hear it at Max volume. This totally solved the problem. The middle plug supports headphone microphone set which works great. It got recognized in Ubuntu Linux 19.10 without any driver installation. I like the manual volume dial. Super easy to tune the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Hil

customer_reviews.title: Does the job nicely
customer_reviews.text: This is a very specialized little gadget. If you need what it does, it works great and for a good price. Very compact. I use it to run headphones and a table speaker during games. I don't use the mic input, since I use a USB mic. The big volume knob is easy. Windows 10 had no trouble with it, even with a USB mic.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Newness

customer_reviews.title: Good For Too Quiet Microphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to help boost the sound of my headset microphone on my Windows 10 desktop. After lots of troubleshooting including checking connections, maxing out the volume, and ensuring drivers were updated nothing worked so I bought this piece of hardware to mechanically boost my microphone volume and it worked after I plugged in my headphones, cranked the volume dial to max, and check the loudness equalizer option. My headset microphone was barely registering before, but now works at the perfect volume for Discord and chatting during gaming sessions.
customer_reviews.author: KRB

customer_reviews.title: Works but cheap build quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son's online classes. He can use the mic and can hear sound clearly, but the build quality is bad. Volume button rattles and feels hollow, wire is too short and thick to bend so I had to use a USB extension cable. I use it with an iMac 2013 and works fine but would not buy again as I don't think it will last long. The volume control is also not smooth, it goes from off to high volume in one step.
customer_reviews.author: Adnan Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t go very loud and is very cheaply made. But for the price it’s ok but volume knob feels like it’s gonna pop off easily. Not exactly a quality item. It works well enough but it’s so cheap in construction that it’s not going to last long so with this product I am not so pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wilcox so pleased

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work under Linux
customer_reviews.text: Detected under Linux (Ubuntu 20.04), but doesn't actually output any sound. I plugged it into my Windows 10 laptop and sound output was fine, so it's not the unit. I returned this item. A pity, I needed one with TRS and TRRS jacks, and this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Antonov

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: One of my headphone adapters broke off inside my desktops microphone jack, leaving me without the power to use a gaming headset. Looked online and found this. Product worked as described! Cable is pretty sturdy and the buttons to mute/unmute are a great plus but I never use it as my headset has a more convenient mute button on it. Personally I max out all volume settings both on my PC and the dial on the adapter and control the volume using my headsets dial. All in all happy customer and definitely recommend this to anyone who needs a fix like I did or is using a computer that otherwise doesnt have a headset/microphone jack set up.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Bengoo
customer_reviews.text: This adapter works like it should. A good value. The cable is only about 6" long, so if you are plugging it into a rear jack on a computer it would be awkward to reach. I purchased this from Amazon and have not compared it to similar units.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodo32

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I recycled an old PC with Ubuntu for a video only application, tested everything could not get the sound working on the PC's hardware. Tried a bunch of command line recommendations from Linux forums to no avail. Bought this installed and the OS immediately recognized it and it has been working like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a silica bead stuck in the headphone jack on my laptop and needed to use headphones to watch lectures on. It’s such a great little thing to have! I like the easy volume control dial, really makes it easy to turn it down quickly if I need to instead of trying to hit my laptop volume buttons and accidentally hitting the power button
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Dream
customer_reviews.text: A simple plug and play device that does as expected. Really helped me out with a sound issue my mac was having. It's portable and convenient. My only issue is the build quality. When i plug something into the middle port it feels like it might break. Fortunately that hasn't happened but it's something to be cautious of.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sound
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it works. It does provide sound if your computer sound card no longer functions. The volume produced, however, is wildly inconsistent. Songs play at one volume, audio from games at a completely almost too low to hear volume. No way to change or balance the settings. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L.

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised, Just 1 Minor Complaint
customer_reviews.text: The product works exactly as it's advertised. There are 3 3.5mm ports, one for headphones, one for microphone, and one for headset w/ mic. For some reason, it won't pick up audio from my headset mic through the headset port (I can listen to audio just fine however). Thankfully, the dedicated mic port works just fine; like I said, minor complaint.
customer_reviews.author: davidsedthisx

customer_reviews.title: This works great and saved me a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: my internal soundcard driver wasn't compatible with Windows 10, so I decided to give this a try before paying more for a replacement internal card. This works great and saved me a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: This worked great and saved an expensive repair!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for me right out of the box. It saved the day since my earbud jack was dead on my Lenovo laptop and I was visiting my new grandbaby so I needed the sound off. My daughter's Lenovo sound jack died too, but hers was still under warranty! This product works great and saved me an expensive and time-consuming repair!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for pc/laptop users as I cannot seem to use it on my console (Xbox One X) or Samsung phone (note samsung isn't the best seller of phones for those plugging in anything in for audio). I do not have a playstation so I cant say if it works on one. The only problem I have is a slight rattle from the volume knob, but the hiss of my microphone is normal as should yours (if you use a separate microphone). Overall a good product for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: nikk

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great and Super Easy Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Super simple plug and play. Audion quality is much better than the sound card that came with the PC. No more crackling and other background noise even when the volume is muted. The audio out is feeding a powered Klipsch sub and satellite speakers. Also have my PC mic connected. Works great. Windows 10 64 bit PC.
customer_reviews.author: 40oz District

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, worked great from day one, cable is short and volume close to jack but otherwise great.  BUY.
customer_reviews.text: I had concerns about using this with the analog connections of my headset I use for taking conference calls with Webex. Webex hates the analog connections and once I added this and let it present a USB interface to Windows 10, all has gone well. I have had ZERO problems with it. Other than having the volume so close to the computer, which I solved by using an extension, it is great. BUY.
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It does work. But I had too high expectations
customer_reviews.text: It does work. But it performs less than expected. It supports ctia, but I have not found a way to boost the volume of the microphone. That is why I'm rating it 2 stars.It works, but overall I learned that these sound card adapters can only go so far. It's not a fault of BENGOO. On the other hand what is a fault of BENGOO is it's shoddy build. It's passable, but it feels flimsy. Also they do not do free returns. That is the only reason why I am keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: welldefined

customer_reviews.title: Good crisp sound.
customer_reviews.text: Yea it works well. For a mono mic. It doesn't seem to except a stereo signal but for the price i don't suppose it would. But good for music ideas with a small 3.5 condenser clip on mic along with your favorite software.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin StarLord Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Adapter!
customer_reviews.text: The adapter works great. The sound quality was great and I could hear everything clearly. The microphone ports also worked great. The volume control takes some getting used to but it also works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good design, easy use.
customer_reviews.text: This adapter worked well. I was very frustrated and mistakenly bought new headphones when my mic stopped working. When the second pair did not work I realized it was the card and bought this adapter. It took a minute to figure out but controls are basically on/off and volume adjustment. Nice advantage is that the connection moves the unit away from the USB plugs so I have room for other connections like my external fan board.
customer_reviews.author: CA Painter

customer_reviews.title: The built in volume control just makes it better than other models.
customer_reviews.text: I don't game so no ratings there. My Macs & Hackintoshes have trouble with audio. This adapter takes care of that problems on all of them.More expensive than the simple ones, but it appears to be better made.
customer_reviews.author: heisetax

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is not the greatest but it works for my use
customer_reviews.text: Saw it on youtube video... took a little work for my situation. I was running sound from a windows machine to a mac. Sound quality is not the greatest but it works for my use. The only other issue I had was that I wanted the volume wheel to be for the sound coming in and not for the sound going out of the headphone jacks.
customer_reviews.author: S. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: I think I had the onboard sound burn out on my motherboard but it's like 6 or 7 years old with a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and works well if you are having sound issues. I think I had the onboard sound burn out on my motherboard but it's like 6 or 7 years old with a lot of use. Bought this as a cheap and easy solution to get sound back and it worked right away. I just use it with earbuds for some games so I can't speak to the sound quality but I wouldn't expect much from it as far as performance goes.
customer_reviews.author: Mac k.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Ham / Amateur Radio
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this one for Ham / Amateur Radio use. It generates a TON of spurious emissions in the HF band from just being plugged into the computer, not even connected to the radio. Also, it is only a 16-bit card. With the amount of RF it throws out, I would be surprised if it doesn't interfere with other devices.

A: Steps to set below.
(1) Double click the volume icon (mini speaker) which is on the bottom right of your computer. 
(2) Select "option"---"properties" and tick "microphone" in the pop-up main volume dialog window.
(3) Click "microphone strengthen" if you want the microphone volume back to "high ranking".

【Q: Plug in the USB-AUDIO and I don't hear anything, what else can I do? 】
A: After plugging in the USB-AUDIO, also ensure the audio adapter is set to be your primary playback- and recording device in your control panel or system preferences. 

【Q: Why doesn’t my microphone seem to work or record? 】
A: The product can work with TRS (Tip Ring Sleeve) jack but can’t work with Mono or TS (Tip Sleeve) jack.
